title: Ottawa Knee Rule
desc: The Ottawa Knee Rule describes criteria for minor knee trauma patients that are so low risk as not to warrant knee imaging.

orgreference.text: Stiell IG, et al. Derivation of a decision rule for the use of radiography in acute knee injuries. Annals of Emergency Medicine. 1995; 26(10): 405-13.

data.evidence: Series of Yes/No questions. See criteria below.
data.facts:
• A knee x-ray series is only required for knee injury patients with any of these findings:
    • Age ≥ 55, OR
    • Isolated tenderness of patella (no bone tenderness of knee other than patella), OR
    • Tenderness of head of fibula, OR
    • Inability to flex to 90°, OR
    • Inability to bear weight both immediately after injury and in the ED for 4 steps (unable to transfer weight twice onto each lower limb regardless of limping.
